results.title: Beer
results.creator_credit: Martin Didsbury, Television New Zealand and Denis Harvey
results.brief_description: Presents an examination of beer production. Indicates the processing stages, and the resulting outputs of products, by-products and wastes. Chemical processes in fermentation are also considered. The program lends itself to students developing a flow chart of the manufacturing system, with inputs of various values, quantities and types.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Didsbury, Television New Zealand and Denis Harvey

results.title: Beefcake
results.creator_credit: Alliance Independent Films, Channel 4 TV, Thom Fitzgerald and Shandi Mitchell
results.brief_description: Based on the life of photographer Bob Mizer who photographed young men for male physique magazines, this is an entertaining combination of fiction and documentary which examines the underground gay culture of America in the 1950s. Centred around Mizer’s trial for obscenity during the McCarthy witch-hunts, “Beefcake” features interviews with models, hustlers and muscle builders from that period as well as creating a fictional narrative about young Neil O’Hara (Joe Pearce), the traditional All-American small-town boy, who arrives in the big city of Los Angeles and becomes immersed in the world of muscles, photography and the incipient gay movement. Filmed in glorious colour which simulates the rainbow palette of the “technicolor fifties”, “Beefcake” is nevertheless a highly insightful look into the cost of repression. The film acknowledges the complexity of Mizer’s relationship with the young men he photographed, as well as his initially tender but ultimately destructive relationship with his mother, who encouraged his work but refused the evidence of his sexuality. And though “Beefcake” suggests that Mizer’s world allowed young gay men freedom for the first time in their lives, it also examines how Mizer himself was blind to the effects of drugs and loneliness on his young subjects. The interviewees include Warhol superstar Joe Dellasandro who began his career as a Physique magazine model.

results.title: Beef, grass and dairy calves
results.brief_description: This film is designed to demonstrate to farmers the new techniques of calf rearing which can be successfully incorporated into existing farming systems. It underlines the higher productivity and therefore greater profitability which results from the new methods when and if they are used.

results.title: Beef cattle in Australia
results.creator_credit: Fred Whatham and Cine Australian Productions
results.brief_description: A concise description of the Australian beef cattle industry, covering such aspects as marketing, breeding, mustering and transportation. Narrated by Roger Climpson.

results.title: Beef background
results.brief_description: Describes the production of fine cattle and quality beef in Australia for domestic and overseas markets. Includes the angus, devon, hereford and santa catrudez breeds. Narrated by Barry Brady.

results.title: Beef and dairy insemination program
results.brief_description: Describes the artificial insemination program at Bacchus Marsh. Outlines methods of collection, selection and storage as well as service to cows.

results.title: Beechworth [B&W]
results.creator_credit: National Trust, John Kingsford-Smith and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Heritage”.
Historic buildings of the former gold mining town of Beechworth, Vic., including the gold office, prison, powder magazine, churches and the Court House where Ned Kelly was tried three times.
